intro: Ixora aneimenodesma subsp. aneimenodesma, commonly known as the red ixora, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences of bright red or orange-red flowers, which bloom throughout the year in tropical climates. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are dark green in color. It is native to Southeast Asia and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. The species is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
